name: HUYER, JACOB
behaviour_type: Physical expressions towards staff, such as: swatting, hitting/kicking, yelling/swearing
triggers: Personal care (shower room); loss of independence and anger with acceptance of support with ADLS. The resident was also reported to have sleep poorly last night following an outing with his wife yesterday.
interventions: The Writer and co-Behaviour Support Lead (C.C) reviewed and updated the resident's care plan to reflect triggers and interventions; see other progress notes.
poa_notified: POA was notified by the Unit Supervisor. SIGNED]
other_notes:
Behaviour - Follow up (2025-11-17 16:50:00): Note Text : Oral PRN Lorazepam Administered. SIGNED]
Behaviour - Follow up (2025-11-17 15:45:00): Note Text : The Writer went back to check on the resident and review situation from earlier. The resident was in his room, continuing to get up, walk around the room. The staff (3) did attempt to have the resident sit back onto his bed upon arrival; however, the Writer directed the staff to step back and allow him space. The resident was in his brief (no other clothing), socks and shoes on, seated on his bed. The Writer and staff debriefed quietly outside his room, where the Writer instructed them to let him be for awhile. 5-10 minutes later, the Writer approached the resident; he was still seated on his bed; allowed Writer to come in and speak with him. The Writer spent some time talking with him, however difficult to understand his words at times; allowed the Writer to apply a shirt and pants; agreed to go off the unit for a walk. The resident suddenly took left arm and attempted to strike out at Writer. The resident then stood up, and did lost balance onto side of his MILL CREEK CARE CENTRE Facility Code: 11/18/2025 Effective Time Range: All Created Date Range: All Created Time Range: All Author: All Department: All Resident Name : HUYER, JACOB (001105) Location : 3 West W319 1 Admission Date : 01/29/2025 (N39.0), Dementia in Parkinson's disease(F02.3), Delirium, unspecified(F05.9), Stroke, not specified as haemorrhage or infarction(I64) chair in his room (no injury); not allowing Writer to help support him. Then grabbed the small side table and threw it. The Writer left room, gave additional space. Was seen then seated in his chair. Approx. 15 minutes later, MD was present in the building and went to see the resident; again, calm and cooperative with the MD, describing his feelings however difficult to understand. MD explained the PRN medication in place to help support him in moments where he's feeling fearful, angry, and unsettled; he agreed to the use of Lorazepam. The Writer immediately went to receive his medication; upon the Writer entering the room, the resident initially agreed to take medication but then tried to kick Writer, again grabbed table and tossed it. The Writer left the room; later alternative staff approached with medication and again refused. SIGNED]
summary: The resident exhibited physical expressions towards staff during a shower, including yelling, swearing, and attempting to hit and kick staff members. A code white was called, and the resident was given Quetiapine and brought to his room for quiet time to settle.
